com.sandeep.machine_learning

Class LinearEquation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sandeep.machine_learning.LinearEquation

  • public class LinearEquation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as linear equation which has co-efficient and variable. Example : w0 + (w1 x X1) + (w2 x X2) here w0, w1, w2 are co-efficients and X1,X2,X3 are variables

      private int[] variableValues

      Creates an instance of linear equation

      • LinearEquation

        public LinearEquation(int numberOfVariables)
        Creates an instance of linear equation
        Parameters:
        numberOfVariables - Enter the number of variable function. For example : w0 + (w1 x X1) here value is 1

      • LinearEquation

        public LinearEquation(int numberOfVariables,
                      double defaultValue)
        Creates an instance of linear equation
        Parameters:
        numberOfVariables - Enter the number of variable function. For example : w0 + (w1 x X1) here value is 1
        defaultValue - This will be the value of the all the coefficients

        Returns:
        Co-efficient value at the "at" index

        public void setCoefficientAt(int at,

        This function helps us to set individual coefficients
        Parameters:
        at - Enter number as index value similar to arrays
        as - Enter coefficient value to be assigned

      • getAllCoefficients

        public double[] getAllCoefficients()
        This function return all values of the coefficients
        Returns:
        Returns coefficientValues

      • degreeOfEquation

        public int degreeOfEquation()
        This function gives number of degrees of equation.
        Returns:
        Number of degrees of equation. Example : w0 + (w1 x X1) here value returned is 1

      • valueOfFunction

        public double valueOfFunction(int[] allVariableValues)
        This function gives total value of the function using values present in variables
        Parameters:
        allVariableValues - Enter array which has variable values in them. Example : w0 + (w1 * X1) then send {X1 = 9} array
        Returns:
        Value of the function.

      • valueOfFunction

        public double valueOfFunction(int[] allVariableValues,
                              float[] coEffValues)
        This function gives total value of the function using values present in variables and coefficients
        Parameters:
        allVariableValues - Enter array which has variable values in them. Example : w0 + (w1 * X1) then send {X1 = 9} array.
        coEffValues - Enter array which has co-efficient values in them. Example : w0 + (w1 * X1) then send {w0 = 0.34, w1 = 0.645} array.
        Returns:
        Value of the function.
